body.body: Create this subtree and discuss basic structure.

Additionally we added a different subtree displaying the structure of a game. This subtree is supposed to show the structured form the game uses to present its content. A key distinction to be made was a game being a match or a game containing matches. Especially for this we added the match based identifier, which allows us to tag the structure of a game as what the player regularly encounters i.e. during a match, while indicating that the game has matches that most likely offer the same content repeatedly. In contrast to that, the cyclic tag provides the user to tag games that encourage the player to repeat the game after a playthrough by providing information or assets that can be migrated to the next playthrough i.e. via new game+ modi. Furthermore we added order to indicate the manner in which the content can be consumed. For the open tag the player must be able to freely choose in which order actions are taken, resulting in missable content or such.

**match based**, instance based (the same but different)
basic gameplay that is repeated every time
complete content is available
**Spielerlebnis** (verschiedene Modi, z.B. Mass Effect)
**homogen**
**heterogen**
**cyclic**

body.caption: 15.04, Tree Iteration IV:

body.value: New Tag?: open world or similar (@rwarnking)

body: This is part of _structure_ â†’ _order_ â†’ _open_ (16.10.2024)

body.value: Analog to narrative choices, introduce choices as a game mechanic.

This is part of _replayability_ â†’ _gameplay branches_, which is the opposite of _replayability_ â†’ _narrative branches_. Furthermore the sum of all _problem solving techniques_ should also give an impression of the options. (16.10.2024)

body.body: For now we define cyclic as 'The game is designed in a way that can be experienced to full extent only by replaying the game a large (but not concretely defined) number of times'. This should be seen mostly disconnected from concerns of replayability and motivation/incentive/rewards. We use the above list as a basis for tagging the game structure in the next tagging round and will revisit it afterwards for evaluation.
Based on the discussion of the 04.08.2024 this tag was added to issue #60 after closing.
